comment.author: 54904823@N00
comment._content: United States Ambassador, I added a short biography to Wikipedia: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Henry_Percival_Dodge He was born in Boston on January 18, 1870 to Henry Cleaves Dodge and Alice Almia Lamb. He married Margaret Riché Adams (?-1919) and after her death married in 1922 Agnes Page-Brown. He was the U.S. Minister to Honduras, 1907-08; Salvador, 1907-09; Morocco, 1909-10; Panama, 1911-13; Serbs, Croats and Slovenes, 1919-26; Denmark, 1926-30. He died in Zurich, Switzerland on October 16, 1936.

comment.author: 35072786@N08
comment._content: Richard Arthur Norton: Thanks for your information on ambassador Henry Percival Dodge. We will add some of it to the description when we update. The Prints and Photographs Online Catalog shows another photo of him and others here: www.loc.gov/pictures/item/hec2008003043/

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: May have been a delegate to the 1914 Peace Conference at Niagara Falls, Ontario, Canada? His photo in Bain's photostream is bookended by other Conference-related images.

comment.author: 97533501@N00
comment._content: Isn't that the State, War & Navy Building, now the Executive Office Building?  It would make sense for a diplomat to be seen/photographed near the Department of State.

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content:
Larry, that sure is the SW&N Building. It shows up in several of the Bain/LOC photos. Here it is in the background of a 1913 shot:
